intro: Kinostemon ningpoensis, commonly known as the Ningpo sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xyridaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Ningpo region, and thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense spikes. It is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and is often found in shallow water or damp soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
